org.vngx.jsch

Interface UserInfo


  • public interface UserInfo

    An interface defining an API for a user interface to retrieve user input and display messages. Implementations should take care to provide the best security practices when dealing with passwords and passphrases. Prompts should mask any sensitive input data and ensure the values are stored safely.

    Author:
    Atsuhiko Yamanaka, Michael Laudati

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getPassphrase()
      Returns the passphrase provided by the user after a successful call to promptPassphrase(java.lang.String).
      String getPassword()
      Returns the password provided by the user after a successful call to promptPassword(java.lang.String).
      boolean promptPassphrase(String message)
      Prompts the user with the specified message to enter a passphrase.
      boolean promptPassword(String message)
      Prompts the user with the specified message to enter a password.
      boolean promptYesNo(String message)
      Prompts the user with the specified message and allows for a yes (true) or no (false) response.
      void showMessage(String message)
      Displays the specified message to the user.

    • Method Detail

      • getPassphrase

        String getPassphrase()

        Returns the passphrase provided by the user after a successful call to promptPassphrase(java.lang.String). Implementations should take care to mask the passphrase characters to prevent an eavesdropper from viewing sensitive credentials. A null return value indicates the user declined to enter a passphrase.

        Returns:
        passphrase entered by user or null if none provided

      • getPassword

        String getPassword()

        Returns the password provided by the user after a successful call to promptPassword(java.lang.String). Implementations should take care to mask the password characters to prevent an eavesdropper from viewing sensitive credentials. A null return value indicates the user declined to enter a password.

        Returns:
        password entered by user or null if none provided

      • promptPassword

        boolean promptPassword(String message)

        Prompts the user with the specified message to enter a password. The password should be stored in such a way that it can be retrieved with getPassword(). Implementations should honor best security practices by masking the password input. The method should return true if the user successfully provided a password; if the user cancels/declines the password prompt, then false should be returned.

        Parameters:
        message - to display when prompting user for password
        Returns:
        true if user entered password, false if user canceled/declined password prompt

      • promptPassphrase

        boolean promptPassphrase(String message)

        Prompts the user with the specified message to enter a passphrase. The passphrase should be stored in such a way that it can be retrieved with getPassphrase(). Implementations should honor best security practices by masking the passphrase input. The method should return true if the user successfully provided a passphrase; if the user cancels/declines the passphrase prompt, then false should be returned.

        Parameters:
        message - to display when prompting user for passphrase
        Returns:
        true if user entered passphrase, false if user canceled/declined passphrase prompt

      • promptYesNo

        boolean promptYesNo(String message)

        Prompts the user with the specified message and allows for a yes (true) or no (false) response.

        Parameters:
        message - to display
        Returns:
        true if user selected yes

      • showMessage

        void showMessage(String message)

        Displays the specified message to the user.

        Parameters:
        message - to display
